ygData.subject: Re: !Quests since the patch?
ygData.msgSnippet: ouch! the first day the new quests surfaced some lv50 necro was camping crusaders to outfit his twink on my server...he s gone now. but assholes make up the
ygData.messageBody:
ouch!

the first day the new quests surfaced some lv50 necro was camping crusaders
to outfit his twink on my server...he's gone now. but assholes make up the
majority of our population inside and outside of eq...so it's just a fact of
life.

it sounds like the heinous "eq-stress" has invaded you and your life as it
has so many others. definitely sounds like a break is in order...

but...

i recommend keeping your account active for a month or 2. i quit eq entirely
for over a month once, for various reasons and i was glad i didn't cancel or
sell off my items when i eventually came back...i don't play as much as i
used to or with the same desire but i still enjoy the game from time to
time. so, as long as it provides 10 hours of "real fun" each month...it's
worth the money.

i think anyone can agree with that.

-kg






>From: Chip Paul <cpaul@...>
>Reply-To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>To: shadowknight@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [shadowknight] !Quests since the patch?
>Date: Wed, 20 Oct 1999 19:34:40 -0500
>
>Countess Bathory D'Allatu wrote:
> >
> > From: Countess Bathory D'Allatu <countess_bathory_69@...>
> >
> > i just got word that the quests may have been changed.
> >
> > rumor has it that possibly only 1 item is need now
> > instead of the 2.
> >
> > NOTE: i used the word rumor.
> >
> > Has anyone gone back to MM or Najena for quest info?
> >
>
>The skeleton gave teh same message today, but conned red to a 36th
>level, which is an improvement.
>
>I, myself, am leaving EQ, beacause I can't stand the majority of
>the people on my server. A druid and a level 50 warrior were tracking
>down and killing all of the crusaders in cazic today so that they could
>do the quests, and then try to find a way to trade the nodrop armor
>to a low level twink. She was not only doing this, but competing
>with me in /auction for looting pieces. Earlier, I gave the rogue
>in my group the ravenscale legs without even doing a random, and she
>wasn't even someone I knew. Both Verant and the players on my
>server have made it more of a chore to play than fun.
>
>So good luck everyone finding your armor, hope you live on a more
>civil server than Tunare.
>
>Xilith, signing off.
>
